column1: At Denver there was an influx of passengers into the coaches on the eastbound B. & M. Express. In one coach there sat a very pretty young woman dressed in elegant taste and surrounded by all the luxurious comforts of an experienced traveler. Among the newcomers were two young men
column2: one of handsome presence with a bold
column3: frank countenance and manner; the other a ruffled
column5: heavily built and roughly dressed. The two were handcuffed together.As they passed down the aisle of the coach the only vacant seat offered was a reversed one facing the attractive young woman. Here the linked couple seated themselves. The young woman's glance fell upon them with a distant
column6: swift disinterest; then with a lovely smile brightening her countenance and a tender pink tingeing her rounded cheeks
column7: she held out a little gray-gloved hand. When she spoke her voice
column11: proclaimed that its owner was accustomed to speak and be heard."Well
column13: if you will make me speak first
column14: I suppose I must. Don't you ever recognize old friends when you meet them in the West?"
